entry.tran: 向一侧倾斜的；不匀称的
entry.def: Something that is lopsided is uneven because one side is lower or heavier than the other.

example.ex: His suit had shoulders that made him look lopsided.
example.tran: 他那套西服的两肩不平，让他整个人看起来一边高一边低。

entry.def: If you say that a situation is lopsided, you mean that one element is much stronger, bigger, or more important than another element.

example.ex: In 1916, Georgia Tech beat Cumberland 222-0. No game since has been that lopsided.
example.tran: 1916年，佐治亚理工以222比0的比分击败坎伯兰。之后再没有出现过比分如此悬殊的比赛。
严重不平衡的经济关系
